question:
[Brad] took his Aunt [Jamie] out for her favorite meal [Mary] was excited to visit her son, [Brad], at college. [Mary] and her husband [Charles] danced together at the party. [Joel] went to his brother [Richard]'s Birthday party [Anthony] likes to watch baseball with his brother. His name is [Brad]. [Anthony] wanted to have a family cookout so he invited his brother [Floyd]. [Floyd] wanted to invite his other brother [Brad]. [Jamie] went to her son [Richard]'s House
Question: How is [Joel] related to [Charles]?

Question: How is [Joel] related to [Charles]?
Task:
The question contains a large set of semi-synthetic stories involving hypothetical families. 
The task is to infer the relationship between two family members, whose relationship is not explicitly mentioned in the given story.
please provide a detailed analysis.
Note: Since your responsibility is to guide students in answering the question, your analysis should think step by step,

Step 1: Identify the family members mentioned in the stories
- [Brad]
- [Jamie]
- [Mary]
- [Charles]
- [Joel]
- [Richard]
- [Anthony]
- [Floyd]

Step 2: Identify the relationships mentioned in the stories
- [Brad] is the son of [Mary] and [Charles]
- [Jamie] is the aunt of [Brad]
- [Charles] is the husband of [Mary]
- [Joel] is the brother of [Richard]
- [Anthony] is the brother of [Brad] and [Floyd]
- [Floyd] is the brother of [Brad]
- [Jamie] is the mother of [Richard]

Step 3: Determine the relationship between [Joel] and [Charles]
- [Joel] is the brother of [Richard]
- [Richard] is the son of [Mary] and [Charles]
- Therefore, [Joel] is the son of [Mary] and [Charles]

Step 4: Conclusion
- [Joel] is the son of [Mary] and [Charles], making him their son.
